intro: Jatropha rivae subsp. rivae, commonly known as the river jatropha, is a shrub or small tree native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain toxic seeds, which are not suitable for human consumption. It is often found in moist, disturbed habitats such as riverbanks and roadside areas.
